Sentencas: The exergetic and thermal efficiency of hybrid systems using various solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) intermediate-temperature fuel cell electrolytes at various temperatures and electrolyte thicknesses was simulated and evaluated.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: Electrolytes reported on here include lanthanum strontium gallate magnesite, yttria-stabilized zirconium, and gadolinium-doped ceria oxide (GDC).
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The Wagner mass transfer model (MTM), which includes solid-state oxygen-ion, hole, and electron conduction, was incorporated into a thermodynamic model for a simple hybrid system.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The MTM-projected performance trends for the various electrolytes agreed well with trends previously observed experimentally by the authors for electrolytes alone.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: The projected exergetic performance with the typical thermodynamic model without the incorporation of the MTM generally gave higher performance over a broader temperature range than expected through experimental trends previously observed.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: Thus, the projected performance of these very important hybrid systems can be greatly impacted by electrolyte choice and electronic conductivity.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: GDC was predicted to have a good exergetic efficiency, but only over a very narrow temperature region.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes

Sentencas: A thermodynamically consistent picture of SOFC exergetic performance from the defect chemistry and solid-state electrochemistry to the phenomenological fuel cell and macroscopic thermodynamic performance was established.
Titulo: Exergetic Studies of Intermediate-Temperature, Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Electrolytes
